title: Drawing, 1881
medium:
Brush and black, brown and blue ink washes, white gouache, graphite on  buff wove paper
Verso: Graphite with touches of brush and white gouache on tan wove paper
markings:
Recto: Stamped in black ink, lower left: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union [Lugt 457d].
Watermark: MONGOLFIER A ST MARCEL
signed: Signed with monogram in pen and black ink, lower right corner : TM
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite, upper left margin: Toltec Gorge.

Mount: Inscribed in graphite, lower margin: Toltec Gorge / D[enver]  x  R[io] G[rande] R R[ailroad] 1892; and on reverse of the mount in ?: No. 110.

Verso: Inscribed in graphite, center left: Toltec Gorge/ Colorado / Moran.
description:
At the bottom of two converging mountain chains, a gorge is bisected by a stream.
Verso: a horizontal view of mountain range beyond a double railway track; same site as recto, but from a different vantage point.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1881.
1881. Brush and black, brown and blue ink washes, white gouache, graphite on  buff wove paper
Verso: Graphite with touches of brush and white gouache on tan wove paper. Gift of Thomas Moran. 1917-17-68.
